snippet: The Food and Drug Administration announced it would ban the sale of Iclusig, which is keeping patients alive but has grave side effects.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration announces it will ban the sale of leukemia drug Iclusig, which is keeping patients alive but has grave side effects; several doctors who treat people with disease say, despite potential consequences, that there were patients whose lives depend on the drug.

byline.original: By DENISE GRADY and ANDREW POLLACK

lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration announced it would ban the sale of Iclusig, which is keeping patients alive but has grave side effects.

headline.main: Doctors Fear Losing Leukemia Drug Deemed Risky
headline.print_headline: Doctors Fear Losing Leukemia Drug Deemed Risky
